memoirs.memoirContent:
[Attached] Jin Ye: 'Ni Ni huanzhi, Zhao Qi, Wu Mingyong-Three Injuries of Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts' (2004.8.1/Paris)
In the summer of 1958, the anti-right struggle of Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts (now China Academy of Fine Arts, the former National College of Art, Central Academy of Fine Arts in East China Branch), has ended. 
While waiting for the final release, we, the delineated right-wing elements, were divided into groups and engaged in various forms of daily work in schools. 
This morning, together with Ni Ni huanzhi and Zhao Qi, I were pulling grass under the eastern corner of the playground. I ignored the mud master Huang Baogan came to greet them and took them away. I thought, it was probably called to announce it. I went home for dinner at noon, when I and Zhao Qi lived in the teaching staff dormitory in Qixia Ling. As soon as he entered the yard, he saw Huang Baogen with Zhao Qi out of his house. At that time, Zhao was carrying only a very simple luggage, and he did not see someone from Zhao's family to leave. I hurried to ask where he went? He said he didn't know yet. I watched him so badly and rushed out of the door by a friend of Huang's surname. Who knows that such a meeting was the last difference between me and Zhao Qi. 
Teachers Ni Ni huanzhi and Zhao Qi died in labor reform
The next morning, I just entered school, and I saw the teachers posted a bulletin on the billboard announcing that the right-wing elements Ni Ni huanzhi and Zhao Qi have been sent to justice by the judiciary because of their counter-revolutionary history. Soon I learned from their families that both were sent to a correctional facility in Fenghua and sentenced to labor. 
At that time, Ni Ni huanzhi lived with his family in Zhugong Temple dormitory in Waixi Lake. After Ni was sent to re-education, I visited his wife and children many times. Listening to his wife, Ni kept writing letters to his family, saying that the labour camp was very good for him, but living conditions were poor. So she had to send him something to eat often. At one time when she sent something, she was seen by a neighbor, and also had some gossip, saying that Ni really enjoyed it. Although such a person lived in the labour market, it was difficult to transform well. 
Ni's wife was a kind rural woman, when one of his boys was only 7 years old. After Ni was sent to re-education, the salary has been suspended. Under extremely difficult living conditions, they are constantly trying to send their husbands something to eat, hoping that he can return home at an early date. 
Zhao Qi's wife, Wang Shixin, was a mathematics teacher at the municipal third high school. After Zhao left, she raised four young children alone, and soon moved her home to the teacher's dormitory in the Third Middle School. At that time, our family also moved from Qixialing to Hong Chunqiao. Although our two families are far from each other, Wang has always come to my house to tell about Zhao's living conditions at the labor reform venue, and also specifically brought his letter to me. Sometimes sit late and live in my house. One day, she suddenly came and happily told me that Zhao might come back before the end of the year. I gave me a letter that I had just received. 
Zhao said in his letter that the managers in the field were very good for him and took care of him in labor, and it seemed likely that he would be put home before the end of the year for the New Year. 
At that time, I looked at the content of Zhao's letter and Ni's letter basically, and they were very good in his speech, but Zhao did not mention that he needed to send something to him to eat. By then, they had been in the labour market for less than a year, so I don't think it's going to come back so soon. The words written in each letter are nothing more than a word of consolation. Moreover, the letters they write are surely to be examined. As a result, the family could not be informed of the situation in practice. However, Wang believed that it was true. I couldn't tell her what I thought was so happy to see her. It was only three days later, I never thought that Wang actually ran home crying and crying to find me, holding a telegram in his hand, saying that Zhao was dead. The message of the telegram only wrote a few simple words: Zhao Qi died of illness on March □ and immediately came to the scene to deal with the aftermath. 
The king could not accept this cruel fact, when he kept crying, and his eyes were crying. With tears, she came back from the Fenghua labour camp and said to me that when she went there, Zhao's body had been cremated. As a result, she couldn't even see the face once. The field said that he was a potent, and did not know what illness he had, and died suddenly. According to the rules on the premises, all correctional prisoners who have died of illness must be cremated immediately. Wang felt her husband died too bizarre, but there was no comment, and finally had to bring a relic from her husband's life, a Swiss watch back home. 
Ni Ni huanzhi contributed greatly to translation art theory
Shortly after Zhao Gang died, Ni was sent to Hangzhou First Hospital in the field, and his belly had been inflated. It was not long that he died from schistosomiasis. Wang's death was unknown. Always wanted to figure out exactly how he died? I asked her to go to Chen Long, Secretary of the Party Committee of the Academy of Fine Arts, and asked the College to come forward She came back and said to me that Chen's attitude was worse than the leadership of the labor market. Chen said: Zhao Qi is a prisoner in the labor camp. It is no longer a man in the school. How he died has nothing to do with our school. Moreover, it is a matter of course that a correctional prisoner's death in the workplace is a good place to die. What power do you have to investigate the cause of his death? 
What are Mr. Ni Ni huanzhi and Mr. Zhao Qi? Today, there are fewer people in school who know them, and most of them have passed away, and fortunately I am alive. And both of them were very close to me both at work and in life. 
Both gentlemen were associate professors in our hospital. At that time, Ni Ni huanzhi did translation work in theoretical teaching and research group, Zhao Qi taught watercolor painting in the basic lesson group. Both groups were my responsibility in the early days of liberation. They were all of Jiang Feng (then Dean of the Central Academy of Fine Arts and President of the Chinese Artists Association), who came to Hangzhou to take over the school, specially hired from Shanghai. 
Ni Ni huanzhi, formerly known as Ni Youhe, Mr. Lu Xun had 13 students in Shanghai, including Jiang Feng and Ni Ni huanzhi. Ni and Zhao Qidu studied in Japan, Ni studied English at Japanese University, and Zhao studied western painting at Ueno Art School in Tokyo (now Tokyo Art University). After Ni returned to China, (during the war of resistance), worked on interpreters at the Military Command Department of the Chongqing Kuomintang Government and the US Information Office in Chongqing. After returning home, Zhao participated in the first national art exhibition held in China at that time. His watercolor works have been widely acclaimed. In search of work, he once worked as a propaganda in the KMT's three youth groups. He was dissatisfied with the rule of the Kuomintang, and with the revolutionary ideals, he ran to Xinjiang to rely on the best talent. At that time, Xinjiang warlords were studying the Soviet Union under the banner of revolution, so many aspiring young people were tempted to rely on him at all times. The famous film actor Zhao Dan was also like Zhao Qi at that time. It was during that period that time he went to rely on Shengshi talent. Who did not know long, Sheng suddenly changed his gossip to Chiang Kai-shek. Mao Zemin, a Chinese Communist Party who went to Xinjiang, was shot dead, and all the left-wing elements who had relinquished in Sheng were thrown into jail. Zhao Qi, like Zhao Dan, spent five years in a jail in Xinjiang. It was not easy to return to Yangzhou's hometown. 
After the liberation of the country, Ni and Zhao were unemployed. In 1949, Jiang Feng and some comrades from the old liberated areas came to Hangzhou to take over the National Arts Department, struggling with insufficient teachers. He found Ni in Shanghai and also found Zhao through Ni's relationship. Jiang Feng thinks these two people are very rare teaching personnel. After they were arranged to work at school, they also felt that they had finally fulfilled their wishes for life, and found the best place to go home. 
In the early days of the founding of the country, all domestic construction needs to be learned from the advanced experience of the Soviet Union. In order to learn the advanced art theories of the Soviet Union, it is necessary first to understand the Russian language. So Ni and Zhao immediately tried to learn Russian on their own. At that time, the National Academy of American self-study Russian came to life. Among them, those who have achieved excellent results are rich Jingchang and Yang Chengyin. Ni presided over by Ni, published by the Early Theory Department. 
In 1956, at the invitation of the Central Academy of Fine Arts, I and Ni and Qian went to Beijing to help them establish a department of art history. In preparation for the establishment of the faculty, the first priority was to translate into Chinese the European part of the world's history of art by Arbatov, which was just published by the Soviet Union. The person who presided over this translation is Mr. Ni Ni huanzhi. 
It is pity that a country as big as ours has never had a decent history of European art, and none of the art academies have ever officially offered courses in the history of European art. Since the publication of these translations by the Fine Arts Publishing House, our readers have been able to learn systematically about the history of European art. It should be said that with Ni as the leader, anyone who had been involved in this translation work at that time was a great credit. 
Since coming to school, Ni has put all his energy into the translation of art theory. He is fluent in English and Japanese, he studied Russian and also studied Greek, hoping to translate things directly from Greek ancient art theories in the future. He sees his work in theoretical art translation as a particularly sacred and noble cause. He is unfamed and deeply aware that only by expanding and enriching his knowledge in the field of art will it be possible to improve the art education and theoretical level of our country. This spirit of devotion is very valuable at any time, no matter what point of view! 
Zhao Qi doesn't know that the right equals death sentence
Although he did not translate much information after he learned Russian, he focused his energies on teaching and painting at that time. He cares very much about student performance and often says I can't mistake my children. And always draw new demonstration works to give students a look. He kept painting himself, and in addition to watercolors, his oil painting was solid. Every time I went home to see him, I saw him sitting in front of the window to draw. At one time, we took students to Lanxi internship, who painted watercolors outside almost every day. He drew a lot of dynamic, very vivid herds. The paintings were exhibited after their return to school and impressed the faculty and students of the College. 
In 1956, when I lived at the Central Academy of Fine Arts in Beijing, one day, Zhao suddenly came to me, saying that he had never been to Beijing, this time he came here to paint. I arranged his accommodation and rarely saw him later. Because he got up early in the morning and bought two burnt cakes in his arms and ran out to draw, and with these two burns, a painting on the outside was a whole day. It can be said that at the time of all the teachers in our hospital, I did not know which paintings could be more diligent than him. At the beginning of the anti-right, he was not in school, went to the northwest to write students. I still do not know that the school had carried out this vigorous campaign. I don't know that the college had long identified him as the right. It was a special telegram from the school to rush him back to wear that right-wing hat. 
On the day he came back, it happened that we met at the entrance of the school. Remember he laughed, 'How did this happen, how did you become the right? It seems that calling me back is also fleeing. However, I would love to try what it tastes when the right is. 
Why did we know the amount of this right hat? The day after his return, the school couldn't wait to hold a conference, dividing him into the right. Whoever knew that for him, once classified as the right, the death penalty was imposed. 
Jiang Feng missed his old friend Ni Ni huanzhi very much. Once Jiang's right-wing problem was corrected and returned to Hangzhou again, he wanted to go with me to visit Ni's wife and children. But where he knew that, shortly after Ni was sent to labor, his family was driven out of the school dormitory, so that they were squeezed in a corridor in a corridor in the corridor of the corridor, and had only been very reluctant to put up a bed under the eaves of others. Our family visited them at that time, and then I was sent to Zhuji rural to reform and restructure my family no longer knew the whereabouts of their family. Jiang Feng heard that these afterwards had been silent for a long time, never speaking a word. 
The fierce face of Chen Long, party secretary of the far left
Wu Mingyong graduated from the 50s. He suffered from lung disease during his studies, and for some time he was in a dormitory of 'a cloud' in isolated mountains. He likes to read, write articles, and often show me the articles he wrote. Among the students at the time was a very prominent theoretical talent worth training. After graduation, he was introduced to an internship in Beijing Fine Arts magazine and was an assistant editor. After a year, back to school to teach theoretical literature and art classes in the Theory Department, as my assistant professor, and helped me launch the journal 'Art Research' jointly organized by our hospital and the Central Academy of Fine Arts. He studied the Kingdom of Heavenly. He made many different views and written a paper on the arguments of the academic authority of the Pacific Heavenly State at that time. This article was published in the inaugural issue of Fine Arts Research. 
Wu was classified as the right-wing shortly after Chen Longlai, secretary of the party committee, who arrived in office. In Chen's eyes, regardless of his speech or performance, since my assistant is closely related to me, it is certainly the little right. Recall that when Chen was transferred to school, that kind of power could not but be repugnant. When he just arrived at school for the first time, he shouted at the congress: I came to you today at the Academy of Fine Arts, that is, the 'Minister of Chin Chin Chin Chin', and if you saw me in the feudal dynasty, you would have to kneel down. I heard about what 'three gold' in your school (meaning Jinlang, Jinye, Zhu Jinlou), said they were very powerful, very powerful. Nowadays 'three gold' (all become the right, see what else they can do, now really powerful is me... 
This 'Minister Chin Chin Chak', who came in, was really powerful, and didn't think he felt that the right wing drawn by this school was far from enough. In order to show his majesty, he immediately pushed the fight against the right back to its climax, and a large number of right-wing were drawn by his hands. For example, Deng Ye, Zhang Huaijiang, etc., before Chen Long came to school, it was a leader against the right, but in his hands all became the right. Despite this, he was prepared to circle some right among the old professors, and to try out all the professors in the school. When he sent the finished materials to the Zhejiang Provincial Committee, I didn't think that because there were too many right wing in the school, it had already far exceeded the predetermined percentage, so that many old professors were very lucky enough to escape the disaster. 
The tragic death of the young right-wing Wu Mingyong
Wu Mingyong, who was classified as the right, was dismissed from public office, stayed in school and paid only 15 yuan a month for living expenses, and had been sent to Dongyang labour farm for re-education. When he returned to school after a year of labour re-education, he was already suffering from pulmonary disease and was assigned in a very damp, dark hut that never shines the sun. During that time, he sat with me for lunch at the cafeteria, and we were very poor at that time. 
At that time, he was in desperate need of nutrition and had to improve living conditions. I ran to the personnel section to deal with him for this. I can imagine that my old right does not have any role to speak for the little right. Soon, his condition worsened and, although he was hospitalized, was not properly treated. When I went to see him, I saw him living in a large ward packed with more than 20 beds, very noisy. He told me that he was rarely able to sleep since he was admitted to the hospital and that the room was noisy all day and night, making it difficult for him to catch his eyes. Plus dry stool, can not eat something. If you can change a ward and be able to sleep, the condition will naturally get better. I saw his dry mouth clots clots in the corners of his mouth and was very sad and rushed to the hospital's dean's room and asked to change his ward. I didn't think the director said to me: the hospital bed is very nervous at present. It would be good to know to be able to live in. How do you want to change the ward? I say that the patient cannot sleep, and it is your duty to make him rest every day. He said it's not my business. You should go to the doctor. If I came to me for such things, what would my dean work do? So I went to the doctor again. He said that when the patient first arrived, they were not sleeping well, and staying a few more days would be good. I said, could you give him a sleeping pill and something so that he could rest better every day? But the doctor said we would think about how to heal. I told Wu about the outcome of the intervention. I thought that since I could not change the ward, it would always be easy to do if I could give him some sleeping pills. Who knew that when I went to visit, his condition had deteriorated. He said he was still unable to sleep and drink only a little water every day. I went to the doctor again, and he said that his illness would have been difficult to cure, because it was sent from your school, so he lived in. We are still trying to heal him. That's why he died in the hospital without a few days. 
For more than 30 years, every time I thought of Wu Mingyong's death, it was very sad. If he had not been classified as the right because of Me, he would have died as miserable, he would have left the world prematurely. He was under 30 at the time of his death. 
After Wu died, his brother came from his hometown of Minnan to deal with the aftermath for him. When his body was sent to the crematorium outside Fengshan Gate, in addition to me and my wife Dong Lin, there were old classmates who had been good in his life: Zhou Changgu, Xu Yongxiang, etc. Although Shen Yun-tang worked with him in the Theory Division, he has drawn a line with Wu since the reverse right. Who expected this day also came to the funeral. One of the most memorable things is Zhang Yanfen. 
Zhang Yuan is one of the youngest female students attached to the Academy of Fine Arts. He met Wu since then. She is often cared for by Wu because of her bad family situation and has always called him Angkor. Wu has also always treated her as her little sister in general, always maintaining such a pure and incomparable relationship between teachers and students. That day, she cried very sad. When Wu's remains were pushed into the crematorium, the body was covered with a white cloth sheet and only two feet without socks were exposed outside. Zhang couldn't bear to let her Angkor even bare feet near cremation, and immediately ran outside to buy him a pair of shoes and socks to wear on his feet. 
When you stand in front of Wu's remains, I can't help but my grief, vigorously open the white quilt on him and said: Let's take a look at Wu Mingyong's legacy together! He was wearing a new blue cloth cadre suit, holding a double punch. His thin face has become completely black, with black blood clots around the corner of his mouth, close his eyes. It was clear that the expression died in extreme pain. 
When I was criticized in the Cultural Revolution, Shen Runtang even stood up on stage and said, 'Wu Mingyong, this little right, really reactionary, has not said a word of gratitude to the Party to death. His reactionaries were entirely cultivated by Metallurgical, the dead old right. At the crematorium, when Wu was near cremation, the old right metallurgical also personally unveiled the shade cloth covered on him to demonstrate to us, telling us that Wu was persecuted to death. See how sad the old right metallurgy should be for the death of the small right that he had cultivated! 
Ni Ni huanzhi, Zhao Qi and Wu Mingyong, the right-wing grievances of three talented young teachers, were corrected in 1978, but almost half a century has passed since the anti-right movement has passed, and their lives and past wrongs have gone unheard. My knowledge of them is limited, but all the things they have experienced are still fresh and will never be forgotten. I am in deep remembrance, with an unbeatable responsibility to write this mourning text. (Paris, August 1, 2004), (Metallurgical artist Metallurgical is a survivor to the right in 1957. This article recalls the three outstanding teachers killed by the anti-right movement of the Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts that year, and exposes the arrogance and violence of the party committee and activists against the right. /Open Magazine 291)

【Attached】Mo Book: 'Lives at the Lake' (Peking University Press 2018)
The third place of our dormitory in Peking University is the Kin Faar by the lake. 
Beginning in 1972, the first days after marriage were spent on the 19th floor 304 in the South Gate of the North, when the 19th floor was a collective dormitory for Chinese faculty teachers. When living in both places, family visits and daughters were born, both took place on the 19th floor. The 19th floor is a cylinder building, from young teachers who have just stayed in school to single teachers who have not yet been solved 'two places', all live together. The oldest, such as Teach Ancient Chinese Ji Changhong, home in Shandong, everyone has become accustomed to his annual family visit career, he is the oldest 'cow lang'. Kim Shen Xiong (Jin Kaisheng), and Hu Shuangbao, who taught writing classes, lived in one room. They had a common hobby-Peking Opera, occasionally went to their house, and also saw Mr. Hu Shuangbao's collection of 'theater tickets' and 'program lists'. Jin Shen Xiong also wrote brush words and engraved stamps; these were seen as seal repair in the 'Cultural Revolution', and the room he lived with Hu Shuangbao was criticized as 'Jin Bao Zhai'. Mr. Kim Shen Xiong's wife and daughter are in Jiangnan, and are also permanently separated from the two places. Also interested in Peking opera is the ancient literary, Mr. Ju Sigui. At noon or evening breaks, often from his house the word is rounded. Qiu Xigui's mother is Shanghai, old lady a famous girl, met me in the corridor, said the whisper is often: 'Little, introduce us to a girlfriend, I really worried, alas...' to see our home food is really shabby, sometimes sent a small plate of delicious dishes. 
At that time, the old man who had not yet married, was not like now called 'single aristocracy', at that time seemed to be a lack of life, to help them. The same 'good year' and 'unmarried', or married and separated, living on the 19th floor there are Ni Qi-xin, Zhao Zumo, Hou Xuechao, Liu Xuan, Wang Futang, Xu Tongqiang and other Mr....
I heard that Mr. Ni Qishin's girlfriend is in Shanghai, and the marriage is still two things. Ni Qishin was classified as 'right' in 1957. At that time, many 'right-wing' were already 'hats off', but 'correcting' was only a few years later. He is one of the members of Peking University's famous colleague magazine 'Contemporary Heroes'. Le Daiyun, Chu Binjie, Fu Xuancong, Jin Shen Xiong, Shen Yucheng are the same group, all belong to the Department of Literary History. After wearing the right hat, his girlfriend left him. After many years, the scar seems to be healing gradually, Ni Qi's heart began to fall in love again. He smoked, stayed up late, pulled Erhu, the sound of 'River Water,' sometimes squeezed out of his door seams and fluttered in the aisle on the 19th floor; however, none of the pieces he pulled was complete. Usually he drink alcohol alone in the tavern in the tiger cave in Haidian town, two old white dried, a dish of peanut beans, spend half a day. When I read the Chinese department, the students have a handbook of 'Qin Literature History Reference Materials', 'The History of Two Chinese Literature History Reference Materials', 'Wei Jin North and South Korean Literature History Reference', the main information and notes are all his 'stupid kung fu' when he was doing 'right'. There is no substitute for these three books after learning, and probably no one will do such 'silly things' in the future. 
Mr. Hou Xuechao teaches modern Chinese. He was a cheerful man of 1.8 meters, when he was a student in the 50s, was once the backbone of the school track team, creating a school record of 400 meters. The record remained for more than 20 years and was not broken until the early 1980s. 
At that time, the story of Mr. Zhou Qiang, who taught classical literature, was a little legendary. It is said that one night, everyone is reading books in the room for classes, suddenly came Zhou Qiang shouting in the corridor: 'I'm married today, everyone came to eat watermelon!' Door doors were opened, quiet corridors immediately mess, we flocked into the 302 house, see 'bride' Mr. Bai Shu rong smiley standing at the table, the table full of cut watermelon...
Remember it was a Saturday in 1974, the last day of an art exhibition. I finished two classes at Peking University School, riding a bicycle into town and wanted to see that exhibition. At that time, the road from Zhongguancun to Baishi Bridge was divided into two sections, the north section called Haidian Road, the south section of Renmin University called Baishiqiao Road, and the fast trail was in the west, along the car, dirt road in the east, walking bicycles and pedestrians. At that time, there were few bicycles and people on the road. Ride near Wei Gong village, back to catch up with a lad, first in my left side walk side by side, handlebar close, then look at four nobody, suddenly the right hand hugged my neck. Suddenly attacked, I suddenly got out of control, even the car fell to the roadside ditch... After climbing up, a blood bag on the head, the bike reel variant, the kid has been riding out of more than 100 meters, still looking back, around a person did not... I put the bike half pushed half to Wei Gong A car shop in the village, then, take a car back to the 19th floor. I went to the door to find that my key, including the door key, all left in the Weigong village car shop. At that time, I sat down on the stairs and cried... and then seemed to come out, sir, as if I intermittently told the end of things. I remember clearly: Later I sat in the house of Mr. Ni Ni qixin to drink water. Mr. Wang Chunmao went to Wei Gongcun to retrieve my door key. Forgot where Hongzi-cheng went at that time. 
Life on the 19th floor of memory is quiet and calm, usually there is little noise in the corridor. Break time everyone will also string doors to each other, if anything happens, will help. When there are nice programs, such as broadcast games, literary performances, put a 14-inch black and white TV room, will be lively, there are always more than a dozen or even 20 teachers, with a stool gathered in a room, excited to watch the ball, talk, and cheer loudly until the end of the event. 
Listen to Hong Zicheng, Mr. who does not watch TV on the 19th floor, one is Wang Fu Tang, which studies the Chinese dialect, and the other is Qiu Xigui; it is not surprising that their later learning did so well. However, there are exceptions when the 'Cultural Revolution', television rarely broadcast the British BBC Orchestra's performance in the Beijing National Palace Auditorium. Mr. Wang Futang stood at the end, always seeing the broadcast end. At that time, Mr Hung said it was Beethoven's Violin Concerto. 
In the early 1970s, the university began to resume classes and recruit trainees for workers and farmers. In addition to attending school classes, industrial and peasant cadets often go out to 'open school'. The Chinese Language Department selected a group of young, born and competent teachers to serve as class leaders. When 'opening school', it was the 'commander' who led the team in full power. They learn from classes, political activities, all the way to eating, sleeping, conflicting disputes. In addition to the class leaders, there will be a few less 'excellent' teachers to teach students classes, also eat and work together and receive education. Hung Tze-cheng often plays this role in the back. My classmates in the Chinese language department Tung Xuewen, Hu Jing Department and Fang Sid have all taken the team, and are all his leaders. Hong Zicheng 'open school' to many places, remember to visit the 63 army of Baoding, Hebei province, went to the Mentougou coal mine and Fangshan Dongfanghong refinery for half a year, and went to Tangshan disaster area after the 1976 earthquake. Mentougou coal mine most worries me, because it seems to have two wells a week digging coal, always afraid of what happened below. 
In 1974 or 1975, I transferred from the cunrui middle school in Longhua County, Hebei to Peking University, daughter Hongyue was only two years old. When Hong Zi Cheng opened school, my most troubled thing was my children. When working during the day, the child is sent to the kindergarten north of the school hospital and pick up the child after work at night. I cook, eat, prepare classes, judge homework, she plays in bed. She was trained to not cry or talk while her adult was doing things. When the time to sleep, but often found her two blush, panicked among a try table, often 39, 40 degrees. Every time I ran to knock on the door of Mr. Ni Qishin, Mr. Ni said nothing, immediately ran over to carry the child. We trot all the way straight to the school hospital, my daughter cried loudly on Mr. Ni's shoulders: 'I don't want Uncle Ni, I want my mother...' Mr. Ni ran while gasping education Hongyue: 'Mom does not move, we have to go to the hospital...' to the hospital, as usual, tetracycline injection, bring back one Pack antibiotics, the next morning, I can only send the child to kindergarten again. I still have to go to class. 
On the 19th floor days, mostly eating cafeteria, also bought a stove for burning honeycomb coal at the door. It was a small stove with a diameter of 25 cm, height up to 40 cm, hot rice, fried dishes, and even when I sat confinement to cook soup and bake diapers. Remember every night when the fire was sealed, Hong Zicheng was squatting in front of the stove, down his eyes close to the door, plug that small iron sheet, let the air inlet only a small slit, so that a piece of honeycomb coal can be on top of the night. He later attentive and experienced, to do it with 3 pieces of honeycomb coal a day can support this stove for a long time not 'out'. 
Presumably 1975 (or 1976), we ended the life of the cylinder floor. Moving out from the 19th floor, the real estate department assigned our first 'home' in Zhongguancun. There are several of the academy dormitory buildings belonging to Peking University. We stayed on the 25th floor a 16 m2 house, shared with another small kitchen, toilet. The 25th floor of the Academy of Sciences frontage street (is now North Fourth Ring), the window car continues, especially to wudaokou railway station freight truck. Often until late at night, we listen to the truck from far to near and far away, windows and radiators next to the iron bed flutter in the roar of the car... When the car headlights are shot into the house, you can see the clock on the wall: one, two o'clock, three o'clock... all day to sleep well. We thought and thought that we still had to live on campus quiet. If you change the house, the house department of the school does not matter, but you can look for the object of the transfer of the room yourself. I went to the collective dormitories in conditions that were not as good as for the change of room. Hong Zicheng is a well-established, timid person who fears things, and feels that this approach is not appropriate. But he doesn't have any way. There was no result in two months. Finally, thanks to the introduction of Mr. Yang Hesong, a colleague in attached high school at that time, he changed the house with people and lived at the unnamed lake on the campus. This time again moved to the cylinder building, 13 square meters, is No. 304 Jianzhai on the North shore of the lake. Jian Zhai is just a room on the side of the sun, we can open the window to see the Lake of Unnamed Lake, the lakeside road of ginkgo trees, the island on the lake, the flower temple and water tower on the other side (then there was no 'Boyatta' Ya Tower). That makes us quite happy. Here, this stay is 6 years. 
Remember to move from the 25th floor of the Academy of Sciences to Kin Zai, I borrowed two flatbed tricycle. Mr. Dong Xuewen and Hong Zicheng, each pedaling a car, pulled out all of our home: the school sold to us a bookshelf, a two drawers table, we bought our own iron frame double bed, a folding round table, two chairs, one covered roll, my cardboard box, Hong Zi-Cheng from the old Home to Peking University's old suitcase, there is a book, two bicycles, then the pot and spoon. 
Most of the residents of Kin Zhai are a family member of a young teacher-two couples plus one child. There are also older, senior senior single teachers, or old teachers who are home in town and far away from the North Road. On the first floor of Kin Zai wet, no home is a 'guest house'. Remember that the second and third floor residents were from the Physical Education Department, Law Department, Department of Library Studies, Philosophy, Physics, History, East and Spanish. The Department of Politics (added 'international' in the 1990s, became the Department of International Politics, and its status suddenly increased), including Fang Lianqing, Huang Zhongliang, Pan Guohua and others. 
Impressive and special sir quite a lot. Guan Yihan, a senior staff member of the library department, she had not been married. When the children first called her 'Grandma Guan', she always corrected them, so called 'Aunt Guan'. Librarian deputy curator is an old gentleman who does not cook, eat cafeteria. Teacher Yang of the Department of Physics was already associate professor at that time, and was single. People were very good, and some gloomy did not love to speak. Hung said he had burned a winter boiler at school in 1972. He married an old companion with a child while he was in good faith. Mr. Wang Yongxing was old and amiable. The children called his grandfather Wang, who later knew that he was a student of the famous ancient Chinese historian Chen Yinke. We live next door to Xiao Weiyun of the Department of Law. He should be home in town and often rest here only at noon. He did not squint and never greet the surrounding households, nor did I speak to him. It was only known that he was a professor of law and one of the main drafters of the Basic Law of Hong Kong and Macao SAR in the 1980s and 1990. Fang Lianqing of the State Department of State and Government at one time believed in the 'specific function', and at one time put a child of Jian Faist in his home to test 'ear listening to words'. There seems to be no result, but he still firmly believes...
The south side of Jian Chai is close to Tisha (that is a large roof, square two-story small building), West is Dezhai, Caizhai, Junhaizhai, Junhaizai, prepare, north of a small road, with the whole fasting. Take the meaning of 'moral talent are bodily sound', most of these buildings were old Yanjing's buildings. At that time, people were accustomed to living in narrow, crowded cylinder buildings. Usually, the corridor is very quiet, when cooking, will be lively: cut vegetables, fried dishes, chat, children running around and shouting into a piece... then, eating is relatively simple. You can open water to mirror spring garden boiling water, staple bread, Hanamaki, meat rolls from Junzhai there cafeteria to buy, spend two cents to buy minced meat, fried a dish, make a soup, you can open meals. Or minced meat fried sauce, boiled noodles, drinking noodles soup, are the usual recipes for everyone. Come to the guests, that is, fried peanut rice, peel two loose eggs, to Haidian town to buy some cooked meat, even if it is 'grand'. So, almost half an hour later, the corridors were quiet again. 
The residents of Jianzhai do not have separate toilets, only the second floor east and west have public toilets, and there is a water room in the east. We live on the third floor, water, wash vegetables, take a shower on the toilet, also have to go downstairs. There is a huge water pipe under the water room, like a half-cut tank pool, can ensure that when washing dishes, washing clothes, dirty water will not splash a place. Residents on the second and third floors take turns on days, one week each. Without calling and reminding, everyone pays attention to public health; in turn, no one is lazy and sloppy, living near the toilet will not feel bad smell. Of course, unpleasant things happen occasionally. Once, it was my turn on the day, and when I was cleaning in the toilet at night, I found that the teacher on the second floor was a switch to flush the water with my feet. At that time, I said to an older woman, 'Do you take the switch dirty with your hands, you use your feet?' She used Shanghai cavity to say: 'Everyone learns to use feet, isn't it good?' I got nothing to say. Know that she will not correct, had to tell the neighbors, do not use your hands to twist the toilet switch, too dirty! She really let everyone learn a hand. 
At that time, Mr. Chen Yiwu, who taught classical literature from the Chinese Department, lived in Jingchun Garden 82 on the west side behind Jianzhai. That was a small courtyard. His wife (certainly did not have this name at that time), was Dr. Li Qingyue, the obstetrics and gynecology of the hospital. This courtyard was originally living in Mr. Wu Teumbing, and Mr. Chen Yiwu later moved in. After Mr. Wu moved to Langrun Park apartment, he came in two more. Mr. Chen lives in the east house, west and north house both live school logistics master. Remember the master name of the West Room 'come', the daughter called 'Lai Yi', that is Mr. Chen gave the name, 'there is a Fenglai Yi', very Qingya. This 'West Sun' position is the worst side of the yard, but Mr. Chen and Dr. Li have a very good way, but also very mood. Their children dig bamboo roots from the campus and planted bamboo canes in front of the north window, under the west window, and planted climbing plants. I can't remember it, just remember the 'West' room, even in the summer afternoon, but also the window bamboo branches swaying, the green shadows in the room. Three rooms, living four people, Mr. Chen and couple live in the north, small treasure and little sister live in the south, still leave a small living room in the middle. 
When the 'Cultural Revolution' and the early 80s, the TV was still rare. Mr. Chen has a 9-inch black and white TV at his home. Sometimes, our family of three, had dinner to see TV at Mr. Chen's house, and they were always warmly welcomed. In the tiny 'living room' of less than 10 square meters, the three of us sat in the best position with their daughters in the middle... But we don't go often because they feel too disturbing their lives. 
Mr. Chen and Dr. Lee love our daughter Hong Yue. Remember once they took Hong Yue out to play, when she came back, her daughter was wearing a mask of Sun Wukong, portable gold hoop stick, very magical. Mr. Chen pleaded: 'has bought pig eight rings, half the way and repent, had to go back for Sun Wukong.' Dr. Lee laughed around: 'The road let us two line up, she was beside the captain, shouting one, one, one, one, and always criticized us for not getting neatly.' Looks like Hongyue was more 'crazy' than in front of us when he was with them. 
Mr. Chen has dinner every night and walks around the lake. Often shouted downstairs in Jian Zhai: 'Hung Zi Cheng down!' Usually reluctant to go downstairs Hongzicheng, also had to go down. Two people sitting on the rocks by the lake, East Lasi pulled. 
The best winter on the lake, the lake is iced, college students in ice sports classes, learn skating, school kids paddle a small ice car. Like others, I also found a wooden board, that is 30 cm long, 20 cm wide, under two triangular iron, and two small stakes plugged with a sharp iron stick, an ice car was done. The child kneels on the ice car, holding back, and the ice car will fly forward. After school, the kids are running between the skating adults, and the lake is a joyful yelling. Ice skating cars are the most obsessed activities of children in Hong Yue and Kin Zhai in winter, do not want to go home every evening for dinner, the end is often an adult carrying an ice car, followed by the mouths of the children upstairs. 
At that time, the masks, skating cars, jumping bands were children's daily games. At that time, every week I gave my daughter a few cents, one fifth of cream popsicles, one third of red fruit popsicles, a bag of five rice flowers, a pack of three corn flowers, and one piece of fruit sugar. I've seen my daughter after school, in a small shop opposite the North DadaEast Gate, the head close to the store's glass counter, probably didn't want to buy anything... it is really incredible to think of the changes in the world. At that time, the two of us paid 110 yuan, the kids didn't have games, computers, laser pistols... but their health and happiness seemed to be no less than their children now. It is clear that 'happiness' is not proportional to the growth of 'money'. 
In 1981, according to the length of service and age, Hung Tze-shing was eligible for the first time in the allocation unit. We are all excited. First post the list of people participating in the distribution at the door of the Real Estate Section, line up according to the qualifications, then post out the house to be assigned, and then select the house according to the queue order. Since he went to school early, Hong is the youngest among teachers of the same qualifications. By the time it is his turn, there is no more to choose from. We were divided into the 27th floor of Wei Xiu Garden, No. 313, two houses in the Sun. The air cannot be convection, but we are still very happy. Wei Xiu Garden is not on campus, in Peking University West Gate Road. 
In that year, Hung Tze Cheng was sick. I was going to graduate from the Academy of Social Sciences, and Hong Yue went to third grade at Peking University. We are divided into old houses that have lived for many years. There was no decoration team at that time. The real estate department gave us the decoration material is a large piece of white powder, a small packet of potato flour, so that we will brush the walls white. The three sisters who are studying at Peking University helped me, first with a shovel to eliminate the grease from the kitchen floor, then use kitchen knives to eliminate the old wall skin of the roof and wall, then pull back two sack sawdust from the school's wood factory and spread on the cement floor (to prevent the brush wall from sticking to the concrete floor). We prepared two large bathtubs, shengled back mixed with potato powder, bought a few pen-like brushes, and also took a scaffolding in the room, please come to Mr. Zhao Zumo, my classmate Wang Yongkuan, Mr. Yang Juchen of North Normal University, everyone wearing a paper hat, dry in the house One day, they were full of white powder, and then they went home for dinner...
This scene makes me remember deeply, probably not only because, in fact, as a 'chief executive' but painted layman, Mr. Zhao Zumo, boiled potato flour into a pot of 'pimple soup' (potato flour is a binder, should be cooked like glue, stirred in a diluted white powder), not just because That big white paint to the wall is always hanging, and finally the heart and inside the show Wang Yongkuan Think of brush a layer of white powder, then brush a layer of latex, that big white powder is hanging... but because in that era, people and people are simple and sincere relationship. That relationship has long been remembered because it is not tied too much to 'money' and 'interests'.

memoirs.memoirContent:
【Attached】Gao Lan Mountain: 'Life Scam' (May 4, 2012)
My life endured too many scams. In 1945, the small Japan surrendered, and the northeastern light was restored to me to know that I was a Chinese. This is a child who has just learned to recognize his ancestral identity, the trauma of the mind is unspeakable. July 5, 1948 Zhang Mingju, commander of Beiping garrison district, mobilized troops to suppress and shoot Northeastern students who petitioned not to be cannon fodder. I was one of the few who witnessed the 7.5 incident. Let me see the essence of the KMT's corruption reactionary. In a painful tear, I vowed not to share the days with the KMT. In 1949, I was passionate about the torrent. He Wei, former member of the Underground Democratic Youth Alliance, joined the New Democratic Youth League in August. In September (a month before the opening ceremony), I became the first secretary of the junior high school affiliated to Furen University (now Beijing 13). Later on, under the motto 'Everything for Socialism,' I need not say much in my student age. 
Once upon a time, at the turn of spring and summer 1957, I have graduated for two years and worked as a technician at the foundry workshop of Shenyang Second Machine Tool Factory (China-Czech Friendship Factory). When I buried my head in the workshop technical work, Zhang Guozhen, secretary of the party branch of the workshop suddenly looked for me. I thought he wanted to talk to me about my party membership. I didn't expect him to say to me, 'I heard you wrote something reactionary.' His words really made me inexplicable. It took me half a day to think of it. I wrote a lot of journals in my student age. He said, 'Can you take a look at it?', 'Of course, I ask to join the party to let the branch know me, I still ask for it.' So I ran back to a single dorm and pulled out all the diaries since 1949 from the boxes under my bed, six or seven had landed enough to be one foot tall. At this point, I think of the desk in my office there was a graduation work first anniversary in order to write a self-written summary of my mind, all my head was handed over to the party branch. Never thought, this summary was actually the lead of my life into the abyss. 
People have clearly told you that it was 'writing some reactionary things,' and I knew it beforehand, but I didn't link the reactionary to myself at all, and I could not think there. I never thought it was privacy and shy away from others, and I never thought about using it to show off to others. Diary to see for yourself, but not afraid of others to see, light and fall, how fears the world! So handing over my diary is not only a burden for me, it's extremely easy on the contrary. 'I was not happy, and I thought that the desire for many years to join the party was about to do so.' 
Half a month later, the workshop director Zhao Yanjing asked me to talk. He is a member of the branch organization. I feel full of heart that he was looking for me on behalf of the branch to talk to me about the party issues. Naturally, I want to push his belly with him. Zhao Yanjing faces me, the first big fool of the day, so I can't help but talk down to say leak: 'You are frankly, I admire. In particular, you could hand over that diary, I didn't think. Your old Gao is indeed a very honest person...' Zhao Yanjing, on behalf of the Party branch, publicly admitted that they had peeped at my diary beforehand. Two years later, in 1959, I remembered that my desk lock in the spring of 1957 had been buried. 
In the summer of 1957, a day at work factory department suddenly affixed to the big print newspaper that criticized Gao Lan Mountain, and overnight I became a ghost. From my about 1.8 million words from my diary, the anti-right office extracted more than a dozen words about 100 words out of context, typing and printing the whole factory to fight. My summary of the first anniversary of my work was side-by-side, so I said it was just a lead. I went away in 1960 because I could not stand this grievance and was sentenced to 15 years of additional sentence (deprivation of political power), for counter-revolutionary crime. Not I pry the Communist desk, but the Communist Party pry my desk, and I became a criminal, and that was the logic of that era. 18 years later in 1978, the right was rectified, some old people met me and said to me that in the year, all over 600 people in the workshop knew that Zhao Si prying my desk and beaten me into the right, just put me alone in the drum. Zhao Sijing named a technician, in fact, every day not working on the party branch, in 1959 not only joined the party but also became party branch secretary of the foundry workshop, former secretary Zhang Guozhen was promoted to the chairman of the factory trade union. By creating false and false cases, stepping on people's blood and tears and grabbing official Lu, one of the Communist Party's stories can be seen from my life experience. 
My class graduates totaled 36, and four were beaten into the right in 1957:
Zhou Tingbin, technician, Shanghai Xinzhong Power Engine Factory (Automotive Accessories Factory);
Tang Fuyan, technician of Dalian Heavy Machinery Plant;
Wang Xingtang, technician of Shenyang third machine tool factory;
Wu Boyao, director of Foundry Department, Shenyang First Technical School (now Shenyang University of Technology);
I included a total of five people, including Wu Boyao committed suicide in 1958 and Tang Fuyan jumped to the cliff in 1959. 
Our class is a microcosm. By this proportion, it is assumed that national college and secondary graduates were hit as right-wing, wronged and killed, that would be a very impressive number. 
Mao Zedong himself is intellectuals. However, what he fears most hates in his life is intellectuals, because intellectuals make sense and reason, and to combat intellectuals is necessary for authoritarian and foolish people. In 1956 and 1957, the people of Eastern Europe set off a wave of opposition to dictatorship demanding democratic freedom. Mao Zedong feared that the wave would spread to China. He made a 'masculine' to destroy the dignity of all intellectuals and seal their mouths, and the whole nation was chilling, and all the people of the mainland were stinging under the authority of him and his regime. Through the anti-right situation, he then engaged in a 'great leap forward', starving to death between 30 and 40 million Chinese people. The cultural revolution, which is the essence of cultural destruction, hit every mainland, 100 million people have been fought for 10 years, 20 million people have become wrongs, tens of millions of young students have lost their path to schooling, and China's economic culture has been set back for decades. As the Communist Party deliberately conceals distortions of history, today's young people do not know the true modern history of China, and people still live in scams. Forgetting history is the greatest sadness of a people, and it is the most worrying of our generation of years. 
Looking back at this life, I feel that the biggest scam suffered is Marxism and Communism. I have been educated by the Communist Party since my childhood, and Marx's so-called 'materialistic view' and worldview are deeply rooted. Even if I became the right to become a counter-revolution, the communist faith has not changed. In the early days of reform and opening up, this faith collapsed with the day, it was a painful process. Find yourself in this life let people play as a monkey, the pain is extreme! 
In April 1974, the United Nations convened its sixth special session. China sent Deng Xiaoping to lead a delegation to New York. The central government urgently ordered all banks in the country to collect the dollar and find out $38,000, which was all China's foreign exchange reserves at that time. Deng Xiaoping led the delegation to New York with all the members of the US dollar reserves in China's treasury, paying rent, deducting the necessary expenses of daily life such as eating. Finally, the Chinese delegation returned home to the hall without the money to tip the waiters. Deng Xiaoping had to tip all his personal expenses to the hotel waitress, and he came home to bring back only a piece of chocolate from the table to his granddaughter. This is a silhouette of so-called socialism in the Mao Zedong era. 
When I was a middle school student, I had a naive and naive idea that the liberation of Taiwan would not need the PLA to fight; because we had a superior socialist system, our productivity would be faster and far more than Taiwan. The Kuomintang that lives in Taiwan is decay. Their stalls of stalls will surely fall, and it is inevitable that the Taiwanese people turn to the mainland. Decades have passed on to tell me that at the beginning of the reform and opening up, it was precisely the capital of Hong Kong and Taiwan that saved an impoverished and desperate continent. It is not that the mainland liberated Taiwan, but Taiwan liberated the mainland. 
Nowadays, those powerful people still argue with their conscience that we 'never engage in the Western set'. Take a look at the so-called civilization in China today, which is not the Western set? All they do not want to do is a democratic constitution and do not want to return to the people. More than 60 years later, the Kuomintang in Taiwan has become a party to prostrate the popular opinion; the Communist Party has also become a corrupt party that has failed to catch up with 10,000 Kuomintang in 1948. The power dispute within the Communist Party is intensifying, and social people are on the verge of morality. They are still claiming 'Wei Guangzheng', greedy God for their own. Is a society backed by lies, can it be long!? 
World convergence, human convergence is an unstoppable trend of historical development. China's modern history must have a day of chaos anyway. (Friday, May 4, 2012)

First, the hometown
The water flows quietly in Zongyang River
Stream, flow is not exhausting my endless nostalgia
West, Zongyang River (commonly known as the Yangtze River), winds from her side into the Yangtze River, the east is surrounded by the rolling mountains of Pituo, sandwiched between the ancient streets deep alleys, is my dear hometown-Zongyang. 
The Han Dynasty had set up counties here more than 2,000 years ago. Tang Suzong changed its name to Tongcheng. After the 'liberation', the southeast part of Tongcheng was divided and rebuilt Zongyang County. When the Han Wu Emperor from the Xunyang Floating River down, in this shot dead Jiang Jiao, once vigorously wrote 'Sheng Tang (place name. Relatively speaking, Zongyang Old Street is a bit of decay. Removing half of the widened streets, the rest is still some narrow alleys and crowded old houses. Organ schools and hospitals have been relocated successively, and few valuable historical remnants have not been repaired as they should. A faction of poverty is broken down. Need proper retrofit. 
Zongyang, a new page opened, the old page is turning over. When can I go back to her side, listen to the voice of my father's hometown, kiss the soil of his hometown, walk around and see the wind of her hometown?

The southwest bank of the Zongyang River is the Great Embankment. There is also a white lake inside the embankment, south to Anqing suburbs, west to the foot of the Huashan. Therefore, the payment on the plaque is 'bruise', without any title. There are many bitter ethnic blood and tears of the leaders of the Tongcheng faction of this great literary! The plaque originally hung in the hall of my house. After many changes and movements after 'liberation', I hope this historic artifacts can be preserved. 
Yatsushiro leaflet. His great-grandfather died early in Penghu when he was young. In order to preserve a cigarette, his family would not let his grandfather go out to work. His four aunt (in turn for Ni Shu Zi Mei Xuan, Ni Wan Zi Ju Xuan, Ni Yi Zi Xuan, Ni Jing Zi Xuan), are able to poetry talents, there are four volumes of Shu Ying House collection, Ni Ju Xuan also has two volumes of late Xianglu My teacher, Mr. Kotefu, edited by 'Anhui famous poems', contained more than a dozen poems from them. In the context of the difficult times of the country at the end of the Qing Dynasty, in the face of the beautiful spring light of the 'mountain and mountain peach tree', a weak girl in a girly woman grows out the generous verses of 'dyeing the blood of the mountains and rivers', is very shocking. 
Mei Xuan, Ju Xuan widowed her family. Ju Xuan asked my grandfather to create her homology in Zongyang. The campus is located in the hall of my house. This is Tongcheng's earliest girls' school. Mei Xuan has taught in Wuhu Women's Normal University. After Huasu female school moved away, she returned to Zongyang, and founded Tongcheng second girls primary school. Most of the young women in Zongyang at the end of the Qing Dynasty were taught in both schools. Was hailed at that time. 'Fenghuang Hill Road, Peach Li into the Spring'. 
Grandfather Ni Yannong (1876-1961), was a kind old man in my early impression. After the Xinhai Revolution, the Chinese Revolutionary Party, who participated in Mr. Zhongshan, opposed Yuan Shikai imperial system. School in the hometown (first do the chemical girl school, and then assist Mr. Jinghu to run Zongyang Tao Gongsi Primary School), Hing water conservation** fish polder. A bandits rob wangjia ditch fish polder, put the guarding personnel together into a room. I heard a bandit pointing to his grandfather, saying, 'Old Mr. is a good man, don't be hard for him.' Therefore, although my family's fish polder shares are not many, the vicinity of Zongyang is an intersection between the Japanese occupied area and the Jiang Guan District. The security is not good. Every year, the shareholders push their grandfather to host. 
Ninghan split in 1927. Some leftist revolutionary personalities including Communist Party Zhou Xinmin and others, also took refuge from the provincial city of Anqing to our home, and then fled to the field. After liberation grandfather became an enlightened gentleman and was elected as the Zongyang County people's representative. He was often asked to say a few words at meetings. Later, he donated artifacts such as porcelain word paintings from his family since the Ming Dynasty, and possibly a small number of gifts from the Ming Dynasty North Korea (the ninth ancestors who were sent to North Korea in the Ming Dynasty), to Was hired as a librarian in Anhui literature and history, a monthly salary of 50 yuan as his old-age living expenses. At the Great Leap Forward, he donated the first two houses of his home (the hall, the back hall and the house that my mother lived in as a child), to run the cafeteria. He died in 1961, at the age of 86. 
At present, in addition to the 97-year-old uncle who has moved to Anqing is still alive, the older generation has died. Their descendants are also scattered throughout the country and even around the world, and only the big sister (1928-), still lives in Zongyang. Two in front of the old house, grandfather has donated, and finally into the kitchen wood house and small yard, was blown up by day Kou aircraft during the war of resistance, the remaining two into the leak, no one dare to live, abandoned for many years. The garden bamboo garden wall collapsed, some of which have been occupied by others to build houses. The homeland is really 'sparse'.

After the failure of Yuan, Bai Liewu stepped down, this matter is no longer mentioned. It was not until after liberation, the Zongyang River was successfully truncated in the vicinity of the Baihe Feng, realizing the aspirations of the people of three counties (Zongyang, Tongcheng, Huaining), 
III. The Tribulation of Childhood (National Dismemberment)
My name is Ni wansun (Wansheng), Anhui Zongyang. Born in Anqing on May 14, 1930 (April 16). His father Ni Suyi (Yuju, 1899-1994), after graduating from Tongcheng middle school, worked in an ocean line in Tianjin, after a long term as a primary school teacher and accounting work. Mother Zhang Yiwu (Duojia, 1902-1943), was born poor, grandfather opened tofu shop for a living. The mother studied hard and received funding from the church to complete high school. Because English is good, he is a secondary school English teacher. I have two sisters, Watson (1932-), and Kwai Sang (1934-2010). Sister Nien Chi (1928-), was born of the former mother Chick. She died when she gave birth to her sister. 
My family is a feudal family with little income. Grandfather does not cure his livelihood, the big man is talented and unable to work, at that time, the young uncle is still studying, the father is a primary school teacher with low salaries, all rely on grandmother (1874-1952), diligent family, difficult days. Naturally, the daughter-in-law is also very harsh. His father's ex-wife, child Zhike, is a child daughter-in-law, and suffers The big aunt Wu Qihua is sick, still has to work hard, often endured. Mothers are financially self-reliant and do not want to be subject to that kind of regulation. After marriage, a small family will be established. Put the old house first into repair, plus the floor and floor, into two floors, living alone. This may be a deep reason for her indifference to the feudal family. 
My parents pamper me as a child. My mother went to teach in the field, and I was home with my father, my father went out to rub mahjong, and always took me around. Began reading reading from the age of five to six. In the spring of 1937, my father taught at the Gong Huabiao Primary School in Zongyang countryside. After washing hands in class, slipping down field doi, water Asakusa more, fluke caught water grass, climbed up. In autumn, Zongyang Tao Gongsi Primary School was changed to third grade. At this time, the seven seven incidents have occurred, the day Kou made a big invasion. The profound catastrophe of the Chinese began, and my carefree childhood ended. 
In the winter of 1937, Nanjing fell. I heard that Yu Xuezhong Department, who had fallen down from the front line, was going to pass through Zongyang, the department's military discipline was bad, and people were troubled My mother and sister and I fled to Hexi Township near the rainy Tangang. Return to Zongyang after about a month. 
In the spring of 1938, due to tension, day Kou may commit at any time, the school is no longer open. I'm out of school and my parents are unemployed at home. My mother was in bed, and dad gave some out of school children in my hall. At this time, the two uncle who moved behind the factory in Shanghai, went to Guilin, Guangxi. Fear that two aunt dragging children on the road difficult, family hope to have relatives accompanied by care. Uncle newlyweds Yaner refused to go. Just mobilize the father. Although the father hesitated, but still went, despite the fights of war, blocked thousands of miles, and then gathered somehow year, put a bunch of children (at this time I was 8 years old, Hua sister 6 years old, only 4 years old, my sister was only 10 years old), to the unemployed sickness wife, and left with patience. Causes the pain of the mother helpless, premature death, and childhood suffering of children. 
When his father left, the situation became more and more tense. Neighbor Uncle Lu Jiao installed a radio, and every night many youths, and young me, gathered in his house to listen to the war in Xuzhou. The news of Taierzhuang Dajie caused this group of young people to boil, cheered, jumped, busy on the street post post. But soon Xuzhou still fell! 
Summer, day Kou along the Yangtze Jiangxi offended Wuhan. Zongyang is located on the edge of the river, on the way into the enemy west, my mother takes us to refuge to the mountain countryside. Because of the number of children and daughters, their young age, a mother could not care, had to foster Hua sister in the four aunts (mother's cousin, grandfather only one daughter), home. In the countryside, our children go up to the mountain and pick up wild mushrooms during the day (a lichen that grows on the sand after the rain), fear bandits kidnapping at night, I sleep in other villages with the cousin Ho of two's family. After that day Kou only occupied Anqing, and did not invade Zongyang, we went home again. 
However, day Kou did not let Zongyang go. In the early winter of the year, several enemy aircraft suddenly bombed Zongyang. We hide in the bamboo forest behind the garden, watching enemy planes hovering in the sky, machine guns fire, throwing bombs. Adults want little children not to sound. Suddenly, my house was blown up in the kitchen. Fortunately, the bomb is small and close to us, but we have no one injured. Later it was heard that more than 30 people had been killed in the street, some bodies hanging on the poles, flesh and flesh flourished. Fear of frightened, Mom doesn't let us go to the street. Zongyang is not able to live. And we fled to the city of Chen Zhuang, a lake separated from Zongyang. Soon, day Kou occupied Zongyang. Since then, until the death of our mother in 1943, we all lived in the city and the countryside. At the beginning, the day Kou, stationed in Zongyang, often went to the country harassed and burned Later, Kou did not have enough troops, curled up in Zongyang, not even the city to loot. 
In the countryside for more than five years, my life was very hard. 
In the autumn of 1941, I went to Renaissance Secondary School. The KMT government said that the school had Communist activities and forcibly disbanded the school. At that time I was only an 11-year-old teenager who didn't understand anything, but the innocent was out of school. In the second spring, my mother, because I had only been in primary school for one year, afraid of bad mathematics, sent me to Cha Shixiang Primary School for six. Tutorial arithmetic and common knowledge lessons not learned at home. I was admitted to Fusan High School in autumn. 
The school is more than 50 miles away from home and is required to live in school. In addition to my daily expenses, my mother has to raise my tuition and meals. The father did not send money home for a long time. In 1942, Kou attacked Xianggui, but there was no news. In the midst of the war, no one in the countryside wants to send their children to study, mother books are not taught, and the family economy is very difficult. Food was not enough to eat, had to famine with wild vegetables and water hyacinth in the pond (when mobilized dad to leave home, promised to help us when difficult, then did not lend a hand). Difficult days, mother's mood is very miserable. In the summer of 1943, when the Japanese devils caught cousin in Zongyang, his mother was frightened, went home ill, more than ten days of high fever. Countryside can't find a doctor, our three children just hurry. Suddenly one morning, mother burned back some, to drink porridge. We were all very happy, which knew it was back to light back. At noon, at noon on August 5, 1943, my dear mother died at the age of 41. 
Today it seems that the mother's disease may be typhoid fever and is completely curable. Mother's premature death was the result of the aggression. When the poor mother raved at high fever, she said that the school had hired her to teach, and the two sisters were going to school. She was most assured before her death was her children. After the mother died, there were parasites crawling out of the mother's nostrils. This parasite is a mama hard to save, for her son to go to high school to earn tuition, dig wild vegetables to eat water hyacinth brought. Think of this, what makes me a Son of Man! Seventy years have passed, writing here, I still can't control my feelings and can't stop tears. Poor mom, great mother! The economic situation of his son today is much better than then, but 'the son wants to keep and go away'. 'Who speaks of grace, can report three chunhui?' 
While studying at Peking University, I also dreamed of mother, merciful Yan is still a man. Once a dream of poetry-

I put it down to the warehouse as a steel downloader, and then transferred to the workshop to do the handling workpiece runner. The attitude of the workers towards me is still relatively good and never falsified. I don't move the workpiece, they just help me to move, or find energetic runners to move. So I've been doing it for seven years. After Deng Xiaoping comeback, catch production. In 75 years, the machine tool repair plant was changed to a high speed gearbox factory. Imported a lot of equipment, a large number of English technical materials and equipment specifications need to be translated, and I went to the Technical Section for translation. I was 45 years old. 
Mistakes have been made almost 20 years. In the early days determined to transform myself, I was also very energetic when the big leap forward. When the big steel is made, the earth is on the horizon, and some workers secretly say they did not make steel. I also doubt whether it can make steel, but still praise the masses for their revolutionary dynamism. In 1959 agriculture put satellites, mu produce more than 10,000 pounds, tens of thousands of pounds, I do not doubt. Later it came out of 130,000 pounds, I can't believe it, good guy! Is it possible to have 65 tons of rice even if it's flat in more than 660 square meters of fields? Before the car's knowledge, I do not dare voice. Later, work in the countryside to help vegetable farmers harvest carrots, the grass in the ground is much higher than carrots. Several peasant women led us to work, and their carrots pulled out were not paid to the public, poured at home, and explained that the canteen was not enough to eat. I slowly know in my heart that one big two public, sweeping the Communist wind, agriculture has gone wrong. Later, a 'three-year disaster' (actually not a natural disaster), appeared, supply shortages, puffiness prevailed, and people in rural areas were starving to death, and now there are data that more than 30 million people have died of starvation across the country. What a policy failure is that. I was right to refer to 'the principle of communism that is necessary for each and every effort to do everything possible' is right when I feel against the right. The leadership made such a big mistake. Peng Dewiti turned into an opposition party. Some people mentioned at the 7,000 people assembly that in the Cultural Revolution were defeated. There is no strict supervision over leadership, no effective checks and balances on power, okay? My comments at the time on strengthening oversight were not wrong. What is bad at work to respect the opinions of the masses, and less force orders, to be a leader supported by enlightened and enlightened masses? 
That's what I thought went through a negative negative shift, but there was no dare to say anything at that time. 
After the Third Plenary Session, the four people helped fall, began to raise a peaceful case against wrongs and mistakes in reform and opening-up. Peking University Nanjing student Cheng Li knew my whereabouts from her cousin (secretary of her wife's primary school), and came to tell me about the spirit of the central government to correct the right-wing issue, and gave me great excitement. I decided to file a complaint to the Peking University Party Committee: 'In 1957, I was prepared to raise opinions to the higher party is consistent with the party's constitution. It is a party member's legal right, cannot be opposed to the opposition, and only to mention it, the opinion is not written; the two opinions themselves are not mistaken in principle.' 
I went to Beijing in March 1979 and found the Peking University Party Committee, and they agreed to my complaint. In just two or three days, I corrected my past right-wing problem, restoring party membership and original salary levels, and reissuing the graduation certificate. Later, the problems of Li Shuhan and Fang Lizhi were also resolved. After returning to the factory, because I work seriously and responsibly. There is no mistake in translating a large amount of material. According to the translated information, all imported equipment debugging operation and maintenance, have obtained satisfactory results and was rated as a model party member. 
Since the second half of 1978, many students such as Hou Depeng (later President of Guangxi University and Minister of Propaganda of Guangxi Provincial Committee), and Wang Kelin (Professor of HKUST), have been working hard for my work. In the winter of 1978, Guangxi University came to business letter, Yuhui said Nanning too far, did not go. The following spring, Hefei China Science and Technology University also came to business. I decided to go to HKUST, but the Nanjing Municipal Personnel Bureau did not let it go to Nanjing, and asked me to stay for work in Nanjing. I proposed to go to Nanda and get agreed. In autumn 1979, I was transferred to the Institute of Acoustics, Department of Physics, NANU. It's 49 years of age almost 50, 22 years from 1957. The most precious, energetic and most critical years of life have disappeared. 
Seven is quite old
During the period of NANDAC, in addition to teaching general physics and modern physics, the main teachers were from Mr. Wei Rongjue, from cryogenic acoustics, supercurrent, nonlinear acoustics, solitary waves, and chaos (including the study of chaotic bifurcation behavior of loudspeakers in cooperation with Tao Dyne, Tong Pei Qing, etc.), I'm not good at acoustic experiments. A fast 'fifty and known destiny' person, politicians, such as power, may still have something to do, but for the long term and scientific frontier isolation, from scratch, from scratch, from the very competitive physical research that has progressed a day, such an age is quite old! In a sense, my view is similar to the constitutional idea of a 'party constitution' within the system that was later proposed. The leadership of the opposition parties, the reckless democratic proposition, is actually about regime change. Great stakes are bound to give rise to fierce opposition. Social unrest, stagnation of production, suffering from people and even the division of the country are inevitable. The subsequent break-up of the Soviet Union and the upheaval in Eastern Europe was another example, where the old leaders had ceased power, and the new ones in power were struggling for power, causing the country to disintegrate and suffer people

Of course, there may also be debatable ways in which young students involved in the 'turmoil' were handled at that time. 
In a blink of 11 years, 90 years of leave. A study on chaotic and confidential communications (the National Defence Science and Technology Commission project), was conducted after the separation. Later Yuhui's disease became more and more severe, and I was completely old. 
I and Yuhui have three daughters. Ni Yan (1964-), graduated from Peking University with a master's degree from Xiamen University and Columbia University. Ni Yin (1965-), graduated from the Department of Information Physics, Nanjing University, MBA, CUNY. Young girl Cheng Yi (1972-), Nanjing University junior class transferred to the Department of Foreign Languages, received a full scholarship from Monte Holly College to study in the United States, and then received a master's degree in economics from Duke University. They all stand alone. I don't need me to worry about them anymore. 
VIII. Tomorrow will be more Yu
'One hundred generations of light Yin pass', a turn of eyes, I have been the year. Reading 'Sima Relocation to Shao Ching's Book' when he was young, was impressed by his words of 'Li Tak Li'. 'Childhood country broke tears, hard work when he was strong' because I always wanted to recall the past. But a lot of people who care about me want me to write, children also want to know some old ones. I decided I still wrote this memory. But in the past let it go, like smoke like a dream. Still should look forward. 
Comrade Xiaoping's reform and opening-up led China to the road to rich and strong construction. The new leaders elected at the 18th Congress insisted on reform and opening-up, re-embarked on Deng Xiaoping's road to south tour, a fresh winds of people, and the wind of anti-corruption advocacy fluttered. I believe that under the leadership of General Secretary Xi Jinping, the future of the motherland will be better, despite difficulties, obstacles and twists in one or another! Will definitely be better!
