【Attached】Nie shouzhong: 'I 40 years'
At the beginning of the 1940s, when the situation of the anti-Japanese war was reversed and the contradiction between the two parties intensified, national intellectual leaders, represented by Mr. Zhang Lan, Shen Junru, Huang Yanpei and other Mr. Zhang Lan, Shen Junru, Huang Yanpei, raised up their commitment to the democratic constitutional movement and initiated the organization of a unified national comrades, prepared articles for combining middle forces and creating China's Democratic Alliance Pieces. After the official establishment of the NLD, as the main part of the middle force, always insisted on democracy, unity and resistance, and with the majesty of the 'active force of the democratic movement', appeared on the political scene of modern China, and 'fighting side by side' with the Communist Party of China. The People's Republic of China was established and the NLD solemnly declares that it will accept the leadership of the Communist Party of China and adopt as its political agenda the Common Platform drawn up by the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference. Since then, the NLD became an integral part of the Chinese People's Democratic United Front under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, known as the Democratic Party. 
Hengyang NLD organization was founded in 1948, in the underground struggle period, with the Communist Party underground organization, to mass propaganda, social investigation, plant maintenance, expansion and countermeasures, has done a lot of work. In 1950, the clean-up process came to an end and was eager to develop the organization, nurture the backbone and create a new job situation. It was in this context that I first joined the League in early 1951. He has served as the head of the group, the chairman of the joint division of the Chinese education division, municipal branch committee and propaganda committee. In August 1952, the market division served as a specialist (secretary), to assist the Chairman Qu Zi Jian catch comprehensive work. At that time, according to the principle of the united war division of labour, the Union Central Committee stipulated that the Union's work focus, mainly in large and medium-sized cities, mainly cultural and educational, middle and upper levels. I was 27 years old, Fenghua Zhengmao, and graduated from college. I had done a high school executive leadership job. It naturally attracted many people's attention. I went to the Union organs for a year out of production. The main achievements were two: first, to capture political ideology education within the Union, strengthen the concept of United War, overcome the idea of 'helping customers' and the idea of 'second place', and initially assembled a number of backbone forces for the League organization; second, with their professional advantages and experience, deep into the grassroots level, to promote the allied members to do their job and play the role of assistant to the party. In the early 50s, the Municipal Cultural and Education Bureau caught inspection and open teaching, caught very tight; every inspection and open teaching, I was invited to participate in the review and was welcomed by schools. 
In the summer of 1953, the municipal people's Government planned to redirect south secondary school to public, set to me as the principal; later the plan changed, I was reassigned to the city II as deputy principal. Also because of the city's first school principal Tang Ji (Party Union cross), in China to study, he transferred the city's second school principal Tan Yuesheng (Party Union cross), to the city, and since then I fully chaired the work of the City II as vice-president. In the absence of school organizations and party cadres, I seriously adhere to the Party's education policy, adhere to the popular line, rely on teachers, rely on school regiments, alliances, and trade union organizations to quickly open the situation and actively create conditions that will lead to a turning point in 1954 in the spirit of implementing the meeting of administrative cadres of the provincial education department. In the school to become the city's largest, good quality education, with certain characteristics of a complete secondary school. As a school leader, I have focused on my career, such as teacher preparation, pilot work, personal participation, continuous exploration, and accumulated experience. Hengyang News (column), published an article on my understanding of improving teaching and implementing 'teaching unity'. Hengyang medical school (formerly known as Hengyang health school), was founded in the beginning, and improve the school leadership core, strengthen teaching management and organization issues, the Propaganda Department of the local committee through the publicity department of the municipal committee invited me to 'propaganda' for its use. Later, the Municipal Arts and Education Bureau also for secondary school teachers, organized a city-wide report for me; also sent Wen Xiuyu and others to school to organize materials, called me 'young educator'. These words of repudiation and beauty are well deserved, but to a large extent they serve as a spur for me. 
I'm not only duty-bound to do what the school should do, but also participate in the social activities. Since December 1953, he was elected member of the NLD Municipal Division and Minister of Information for two consecutive terms. Since April 1954, two consecutive sessions were elected as municipal people's representatives, second district (Chengbei District), first people's representatives and government members. I insist on a principle; do not hang a blank title, every meeting will come, will speak and start thinking about the problems of mind, especially the Union organs are in close proximity, more than asking the work of a little League, and caring for the consolidation and development of the organization, it is more reasonable for granted. It is almost possible to say that before I was called the 'right', the main documents that occurred within the League were mostly finalized by me. A group of middle and upper intellectuals such as Chen Zhi Sen, Qu Xiangrong, Ou Jianhong, Liu Guangzu, Wang Sanyi, Cao Liuzhong, Haulizhong, etc., were also developed under my direct and indirect influence. 
In February 1956, the NLD convened two congresses to put forward the slogan 'All for socialism' as the overall policy task of the NLD in the future. Since then, the provincial branch of the NLD was renamed the NLD Provincial Committee; the NLD municipal branch was renamed the NLD Municipal Committee; and the grass-roots division was renamed branch branch. When I formulated the seven-year plan for ideological and political work in the League City, I stressed that promoting the intellectuals associated with the Union is the soul of the League's work, and that working to connect with the masses must be faithfully reflecting their opinions and legitimate demands, and paying attention to propagating the party's policy towards them. Over the years, I have been relentlessly reading Chairman Mao's book and the classic writings of Director Marxiser, and engaged in a five-year scientific research plan, ambitious, and wanted to systematically justify 'Chairman Mao's great contribution to Marxist Leninism.' Later, this plan is as a 'typical' captured by the municipal education union system in response to the party's call to advance into science. 
In April 1957, the Communist Party Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPPCC), came forward to organize the municipal people's representatives and CPPCC members to inspect the literary front. A briefing session will be held later, and I was pushed to take the floor during the briefing by the Literary Front Inspection Group. Because it is reporting, according to the record, I do not take any trade-offs, do not make personal analysis, how the grass-roots talk, that is, to reflect it factually. Only at the end of my speech, I spoke a little personal opinion, and that in order to implement the policy of 'a lot of flowers and bring out new things', the CPC Municipal Committee must strengthen political ideological leadership for entertainers and further Improve performance conditions and do more specific help. At the end of the month, the Communist Party Committee held a forum on knowledge. The meeting was attended by me and Deng Guangju, director of the three hospitals, and Wang Jialin, director of the four hospital. At the beginning of my statement at the meeting, I highly praised Chairman Mao's speech at the Supreme State Council as a new development of Marxism Leninism and certainly a great encouragement to himself. I immediately contacted some of the problems that existed in the pilot work of the 'anti-general democracy movement' II, from the leadership and the masses. Face to look for reasons and find solutions. I said that in order to resolve these problems, we must follow the 'uniting-criticism-unity' approach, based on Chairman Mao's teachings, and be honest and honest. This meeting, Hengyang News made a detailed report, 'Hengyang News' reproduced only a summary, and only covered my statement. In May, the League Provincial Committee was replaced by me, temporarily acting as deputy chairman committee, in July starting salary from the Union organ, municipal administration changed to part-time, I said that I obey the arrangement. In June, invited to participate in the expanded meeting of the Standing Committee of the CPPCC. I talked about the issue of party-political relations and intellectuals. I said: The party is a high-level form of organization for the proletariat. Without party leadership, there can be no proletarian dictatorship and socialism. Therefore, the Party's leadership in all aspects of the country's work is unwavering and welcome by the masses. The question is not whether the party should and can lead, but how the party leads. I think that the basic way for the Party to realize its own leadership should be to put forward the correct ideas and lines, and to turn it into the government's policy and policy and the conscious actions of the masses through discussion of consultations and persuading education. As for the specific work belonging to the government, the organization of the party should be supported by principle. Rudder, play a guarantee and supervisory role, and should not intervene in ultra vires with a 'special identity'. If I have no mistakes in these views, then, I think there are a lot of phenomena worth considering when measuring the party and government relations in Hengyang city with these views. On the question of intellectuals, I think that the Party Central Committee has always attached great importance to the unity education of intellectuals. The estimates are also very correct for the progress of intellectuals over the years and their role in socialist construction. There is no 'copper wall' between the whole party and intellectuals; Some local leaders and cadres have a rocking phenomenon in implementing the Party's policies. In conclusion, I am self-critical of the work of the NLD, and I said that, as an assistant to the intellectuals and the Communist Party, it is far from doing well in these areas and should be significantly improved in the future. 
Above is the main words and deeds of my young age business with the years before 1957. I remember that the leader of the United Front Work Department of the Hunan District Party Committee revealed to the Party Committee that Hengyang Nie shouzhong is a young and effective cadre of the Democratic Party. To be sure, 8 years of hard work, some shortcomings in the work, understanding of the one-sided nature, but a sincerity to the day can watch, there is nothing sorry about the party. Before the CPPCC meeting, 'Hengyang News' also set up a 'column', every day is a quarter of the layout, to 'right' row 'seats', then called 'Zhang' (Bejun), Luo (Longji), Chu (Anping), Du (Maizhi), Nie'. A whimsical article, covered, really blue thunderbolt, 'is a woe to escape'. I was hit right, battered for a year. As the movement progressed in depth, the leaders of the League Municipal Committee have successively landed Qu Zijian, Jiang Xun, Pi Xinxuan, Zhou Ji, etc., occupy about 3/4 of the leadership team; grassroots cadres or general members of the League are misclassified as right-wing with Liao Xianhao, Huang Zhipu and other 22 people, accounting for about 1/6 of the total number of alliance members. Hengyang League organization since then vitality injury, a loss. 
On June 1, 1958, the organization announced the treatment of me: the removal of all posts inside and outside the Union, dismissal from public office and re-education through labour. After three and a half years, he lifted re-education through labour, as 'idle labor' in society, relying on temporary workers to support their families, rain and wind, 18 spring and autumn, wives and children suffer from strains of discrimination, eating a lot of hardship, naturally needless to say. 
The Third Plenum of the 11th Central Committee of the 11th Central Committee, as Chunlei, gave me a second life in politics. Since then, I was a lecturer in Hengyang teacher, director of the Education and Technology Committee, director of the Communist Committee of Arts, Education and Technology Committee, director of the Political Liaison Committee and Municipal Committee Consultant; in the municipal CPPCC Standing Committee two sessions, one CPPCC member. Looking back, 40 years have passed, why repent? In this year too rare, 'dying old candlestick frightened, deaf heart to children. The best opportunity to fight, heavy care and friends attack.' It can be said so, however, the 'sunset red' is not a dynasty after all. It really wants to do something to the Party to the people, how easy to talk about it! Friends' love, ordered to leave a little claws on the passing years, because the 'chronicle poem' has not yet been paid. 'Poetry, singing words', is not history, but also history, sins, for readers to 'anatomy sparrow' can also be order. Ding Ugly Autumn Day

【Attached】Li Yixiu: 'Nie yuchan-the first person to engage in higher care education in China'
Nie yuchan is a nursing educator, nursing administration expert. The first person in China to work as a leader in higher nursing education. We have trained a group of excellent nursing teachers and nursing administration personnel in China, and established a complete nursing management system. She insists on high standards, strict requirements, learning to use, school use, and set a model of nursing work in higher education and teaching hospital care. She attached importance to public health care and stressed the importance of health literacy. Later she went through a bumpy, but not enough commitment; as long as there was a chance to work, go all out. She has been academically advanced, technically advanced, dedicated to her career, and has established the image of a true white warrior. 
Nie Yuchen, formerly known as Nie yuchan, was born on May 11, 1903 in Dusai Town, Funing County, Hebei Province, an enlightened gentleman's family with a brother and a sister and two brothers. At that time, the idea of being a woman who had no talent was German was very common. The woman who was able to go to private school was already a far-reaching woman, while Nie Yuchen's father was open to mind, not to favor men and women. He used the county's temples to run schools to recruit boys and girls to study. Their children are also treated equally regardless of sex and choose a good school to send them to study. He believes that the biggest ills in society at that time were poverty, foolish, weak and private, and that everyone had a responsibility to deal with them and remedy them. Nie yuchan admired her father since childhood, was deeply influenced by his thoughts, and was determined to make a difference when he grew up. 
After graduating from local primary school, Nie Yuchen's father sent her and her sister to Tianjin Central and Western Girls High School. This is a church school, teaching rigorously and has a good reputation. Nie yuchan clever people, excellent academic achievement. In addition to various recreational activities on campus, she also participated in the Tianjin student movement led by Zhou Enlai. After reaching out to society, she felt more weak in China, thinking from time to time about what she could do. At that time, there were few jobs for women except as housewives, and once married, they could easily be dismissed. She thought again and again, believing that she could be a doctor to remove the Chinese 'East Asian sick man' hat; and was determined not to marry for life in order to play her full capacity in her career. 
Nankai University has close ties with Chinese and Western girls middle school. Outstanding graduates of Chinese and Western women can be sent to Nankai University without trial guarantee. Nie yuchan was one of the escorts, but she did not go because Nankai University had no medical department, and she directed the Beijing Union Medical College. With medical schools and nursing schools, the Union Medical College was the highest medical institution in the country at that time; the entrance examination was very strict, with a small number of admissions per year and fewer girls enrolled. In 1923, Qiu Nie Yuzen was admitted. 
Before entering school, Nie yuchan knew little about nursing work. After entering the Union Medical College, she began to contact some nursing students, including one of the third-graders who were her past classmates. At the first meeting, Nie Yuchen saw that they were dressed in blue and white very elegant overalls, gracious attitude and courteous, they had a cordial feeling and a good impression on the nurses. They introduced her to study and live in nursing schools. She then approached a number of nurses. There is an operating room nurse who is the mother of her secondary school classmates, paying special attention to her life and study. The nurse often briefed Nie Yuchen on the importance of nursing work, describing the current lack of medical care, especially the lack of leadership skills. She praised the advantages of discipline and discipline, and encouraged Nie Yuchen to move to nursing school. She believed that in society at that time, being a nurse was the most productive career for women. Affected by this, Nie yuchan thought repeatedly, thinks that care is indeed an important part of the health care business. You should change the nurse yourself. Nurses do not depart from their original intention to treat 'weak'. Nurses can also contribute to improving people's physical quality and rehabilitation of patients. In addition, school care time is shorter than medicine and can work early, which can reduce the financial burden on the families who are not wealthy, and can also invest early in the nurses who lack talent Wu. Thoughtful and determined again, Nie yuchan submitted his application to the Academic Affairs Office of the Union Medical College for transfer from medical school to nursing school. The history of nursing profession in China is very short, only in 1884 by American nurse Mikchini (Mckchini), into China, and in 1888, American Johnson (JOHN), opened the first nurse school in Fuzhou. Due to the influence of feudal consciousness and the lack of a formal education system, the general population considers care as low-grade jobs, with few willing to do so, and the majority of the society disregard nurses. Many nurses also lack self-esteem, active research into business, and striving to move forward; resulting in a slippage in care work from time to time. And Nie Yuchen decided to transfer care from medical care. At that time, nursing education in the country was still in its infancy, and there was no uniform teaching standard and academic system. With the exception of a very few nurse schools that enroll high school graduates, most recruit junior high school graduates, or even primary school graduates. Learning methods are mostly apprenticeship, theoretical lessons are few, many internships, and actually use the cheap labor of nurse students to work for the ward. There are few nurses graduating in the ward, mostly by senior students leading lower grades, with more than 72 hours of internship and class hours a week, so many nurses are those with religious beliefs as a dedication, and generally few people are willing to work as nurses. 
The founders of the Union Medical College understand the close relationship between medical care and believe that it is not possible to have quality medical education and improve the quality of care. Therefore, it was decided to organize nursing schools of the same level as the world's best advanced nursing schools, in conjunction with medical schools, in order to develop advanced care cadres. At that time, there were only a small number of translated secondary nursing materials in the country. In order to improve the student's standard, it was necessary to read a large number of reference books in foreign languages. Therefore, it was decided to teach English in addition to one Chinese language curriculum, and it was very demanding for students, although this was a university level, with the training of nursing teachers and backbone as the first task. There are still few scholars. When Nie yuchan asked to transfer to the nursing school, the first class of students of the school had not yet graduated, and the whole school students were just over 10. Nie yuchan's application caused great confusion to the school authorities, believing that she was a one-time impulse before making such an abnormal application, and was therefore not granted. However, once Nie yuchan has made a determination, it is difficult to change her mind. She has repeatedly applied, and the school replied that parental consent is required to be considered. Nie yuchan wrote to her father explaining his willingness to transfer a nurse. Her father replied: 'Choosing a career is a great thing for you in your life and it's up to you to decide.' As a result, she was finally authorized to transfer from medical school to nursing school. 
Kyowa Nursing School has a wide range of courses, and Nie Yuchen carefully studied. 'What is the use of doing a nurse to learn so many courses' from time to time from time to time, but she is not moved. 
After graduating from 1927, Nie Yuchen was hired as Deputy Nurse Chief of Concord Hospital Ward. While she leads nurses for clinical care, she often understands patients and analyzes the causes of their onset. She saw that these patients were not only physically and mentally suffering, but also that many people left the world prematurely because they were unable to heal or were too late to seek medical treatment. If they have knowledge of hygiene and develop good habits, it is easy not to get sick. Although she constantly propagates disease prevention care knowledge to patients in the ward, she always feels that it is too late to do publicity at this time. The disease should be prevented in the future. The general public must have health knowledge in order to enable them to enhance their physical health and reduce the incidence. In the area of nursing, public health care has just begun in China, and Nie Yuchen is determined to move from hospital to society. She applied to the Ministry of Nursing to the Ministry of Nursing to the First Health Office of the Public Health Laboratory Area of Medical College as a public health nurse. The hospital did not want to lose such a promising nurse chief, suggesting that if they were to be transferred as a public health nurse, they had to move out of the nurse dormitories and lower salaries. Nie yuchan, regardless of personal gains and losses, accepted the conditions and began public health care work. 
Nie yuchan has performed well in her work. The School of Medicine decided to send her to the Department of Public Health, School of Medicine, University of Toronto, Canada, in 1929 to pursue public health care. In 1930 she obtained a certificate of public health care. She was also asked to continue her studies at Columbia University Teachers College in the United States. She graduated in Nursing Education and other courses and obtained her Bachelor of Science in 1931. After returning home, he served as Public Health Care Director of Beiping First Health Firm, training a group of early public health nurses in China and broadened the field of preventive medicine in China. She was the first person to engage in higher nursing education in China. Cultivate a number of excellent nursing teachers and nursing administration personnel. After the bumpy in life, still steadfast, love work, tireless. Nie yuchan not only has talent, perseverance and courage in his work, but also actively participates in social activities. She participated in student movements during secondary school. In 1933, she hosted the Beijing Nurses Congress on behalf of the Chinese Nurses Association (later renamed Chinese Nursing Society, China Nursing Society, now known as China Nursing Society), calling nurses to participate in anti-Japanese ambulance work; and organized ambulance training courses for college and secondary school students. In 1937, he was elected representative of the Public Health Committee of the International Association of Nurses. He was elected Chairman of China Nursing Society in 1946. In 1947, a delegation from the Chinese Nursing Society (including Wang Yafang, Lai Zuhua, Zhu Bihui and Tian Cuili), went to the United States to attend the Ninth International Nursing Association Congress and the General Assembly. In 1948, Nie Yuchen conveyed the spirit of the International Nurses Conference and laid out the work of the Society. In 1950, Nie Yuchen was elected as the executive director of the Society. In 1962, he was elected President of Anhui Branch of the Chinese Nursing Society. Nie Yuchen was selected as an honorary member in 1983 due to her long-term contribution to the work of the Chinese Society of Nursing. In recognition of Nie Yuzen's contribution to nursing education, in 1987, KUH Alumni Kwok Huanwei initiated and first donated to set up the Nie Yuzen Award Fund. The move received a response from many alumni and friends abroad. Since 1989, two teachers receive this bonus each year. In 1988, Nie Yuchen was hired as honorary director of nursing department by Peking Union Medical University of China. Nie yuchan in academic research and enterprising, technical excellence, everywhere. Lead by example, regardless of adversity, with excellent work performance and frank attitude to impress, established a tall image of a true white angel, won the respect of people. 
On August 22, 1998, Nie Yuchen died of heart failure in Beijing Union Hospital due to lung infection. 
First person in higher nursing education in China
In 1935, the Department of Health and the Ministry of Education of Nanjing National Government jointly established three education committees for medicine, nurses and midwives. Nie yuchan was appointed as secretary of the Nurse Education Committee. He was responsible for investigating the situation in nurses schools nationwide, setting standards for nurses schools, and qualified persons registered. This work has some significance for raising the national level of nursing education, but the work is not easy, and is often interfered and constrained by various aspects. Nie Yuchen believes that in order to make her work unrestrained by others, it is necessary to improve his own level. In 1936, he went to the United States again to enter the University of Michigan Medical School of Public Health at his own expense. Student education. Master of Science degree in 1938 and a doctoral scholarship. At this time, the artillery fire of the domestic anti-Japanese war has started, and Nie yuchan gave up his scholarship and departed for home. 
She was planning to visit her old mother in Beiping and went to the mainland. But Nie yuchan's return home was informed by the Dean of the Union Medical College. They are looking for a Chinese man who can replace Hu Zhimin, the outgoing Nursing School Principal. After the study, the board agreed that Nie yuchan's education, qualifications, talents and boldness met the requirements of the successor principal, and decided to hire her to the job. Hu Hengde, Dean of the Union Medical College, invited her to apply. Nie yuchan said she was going back to China to help fight the sunrise. Hu Hengde said: 'The Nursing School of Union Medical College is the only senior nursing school in China, and now we have to give the position of principal to the Chinese. Is it not more meaningful than you go to the Mainland by taking over as a principal, and can train many nurses who can play a role in all parts of the country?' Nie yuchan was persuaded to assist Hu Zhimin in 1938 as assistant principal. In 1940, Hu Zhimin returned to the United States, and Nie Yuchen took over the position of Principal Nursing School. 
Nie yuchan is the fourth president and the first Chinese to serve as Director of the Nursing Department of Concord Hospital. She took office when she took office secretly determined, the first was to compete for the Chinese people and to run a better care school. She worked at her work, working in the office every morning at 6:30am. She attaches great importance to the curriculum. She believes that students entering nursing schools must study social sciences, pedagogy, psychology, biology, chemistry and other social and natural sciences at the university so that they can think and analyse health, disease and care from a physiological, psychological and social perspective. She also attaches great importance to nurse students' moral quality, teaching nurse ethics in person. She believes that theory must be factual in learning. She asked teachers to take students to the ward for clinical observation when teaching a certain disease, care and technical operation. Students should be guided by the theory they learned during the internship, and the study is consistent. All kinds of nursing operations must have more than three practical experience to graduate, and if there is no chance to complete during the internship, the teacher is responsible for arranging students to return to the school to fill up the practice experience even if you have left the undergraduate degree. Each student completes a case study during an internship in the internal and surgical wards. Teachers select cases and assign students to take care of the patient from admission to discharge. Students' comprehensive observation and understanding of the patient, including their personal history, family situation, social background and etiology, condition, diagnosis, treatment and course of the patient, analysis, treatment and course of the patient, the analysis and development of the care plan for all aspects of the body and psychosocial care and the facilities to be adopted Physical measures, modified or supplemented according to the effect of implementation and the progress of the disease. Before the patient is discharged from the hospital, the nursery must not only give good health care guidance, but also contact the social services department in the hospital to help them solve their problems. Finally, students have to write a complete report to the teacher, who selects the best to communicate among their classmates. 'Case studies' are a very important measure in internships. This approach not only provides students with a detailed understanding of care work, taking care of patients as thoughtful, emotional and socially connected persons, but also strengthens students' ability to observe and analyze, and is effective in developing high-quality nurses. In order to ensure that the theory is consistent with the practical and learned, Nie yuchan also stressed that the nursing school teachers must also serve as internship hospital ward supervisors, and are responsible for leading the nursing work and clinical teaching of the ward, so that what is learned in the classroom and what is done in the ward is perfectly matched. 
In the area of hospital care administration, Nie Yuchen requires all wards to draw up complete care routine and operating procedures, and print them into a book, as the norm that nurses must observe and study materials for students. Newly hired nurses must be familiar with these routines and operations before they can be formally introduced. Ward items have a certain place, inventory, please have uniform rules, ward management to be standardized. Patient care is a high standard and demanding, and no error or negligence is allowed. Every nurse, head of nurse and supervisor is required to perform a regular job appraisal, which is signed by the nurse himself, and is placed in the personal technical file of the Department of Nursing as a reference for appointment and promotion. 
The Pacific War broke out at a time when Nie yuchan's work is flourishing. On December 8, 1942, Nie Yuchen arrived at the office at 6:30am as usual. This day is the first day for third-grader students to attend the three-day graduation examination sponsored by the Chinese Institute of Nursing. If this door fails, you cannot take the next two days of the exam, so everyone is nervous. Year 2 students are in obstetrics, gynaecology and paediatric wards, and first-grade students are attending classes. More than eight o'clock in the morning, the hospital was occupied by the Japanese invading forces. Nie yuchan feared that the students taking the exam panicked and affected their grades; immediately went to the examination room and told the students: 'There is a visit by the Japanese army today. This is unusual, everyone do not panic, the exam will be conducted as usual.' This stabilizes the student's emotions. Later, even though the Japanese army moved into the examination site, the examination was still held, and all the students who took the exam passed the exam and obtained a certificate. Under such exceptional circumstances, Nie Yuzen did not relax the teaching and internship work of students for a minute, and did not delay a little homework before the Japanese invading army ordered the suspension of classes. On 19 January 1942, the Japanese Aggression Army ordered the sections to be closed for one week and students to withdraw from the dormitories within two days. Nie yuchan secretly dispersed students to internships in hospitals such as Dao ji, colleagues, women and infants and neutrals and the First Health Office, and arranged teachers to attend classes so that students can complete their studies and participate in and pass the graduation examination of the Chinese Institute of Nursing, and issued certificates to faculty members. in order to work otherwise. Nie yuchan's spirit of responsibility in the end under this extremely difficult circumstances moved all the teachers and students at the time. 
In the spring of 1943, after Nie yuchan placed the students properly, he travelled to the Mainland with his three brothers. Intended to go to the Mainland to resume school. At that time, the Japanese invaders were very controlled, and they departed with simple outfits, moving along the way to train, row cars, trucks, and move hard. On the way, her three brothers were unfortunately shot dead in a quarrel with KMT soldiers. Nie Yuchen waved his tears after his three brothers and went on to move forward, and arrived in Chongqing two months later. At that time, intransigent universities gathered in Chengdu, students have a rich source and strong strength of teachers in the early courses. Some teachers and graduates of the former Union Nursing School also came to Chengdu. At that time, West China University was building a new hospital, and student internships were not a problem, but decided to resume school in Chengdu. In that year, students who had completed the pre-care requirements were enrolled from various universities in Chengdu. The new hospital at West China University, which had not yet been fully completed, was officially opened in September that year. Nie yuchan led everyone to work together, work hard, maintain the inherent level of Xiehe Nursing School. At the same time, given the shortage of teachers in nursing schools at that time, Nie yuchan also launched a two-year teacher training class to train nursing education talents. 
In August 1945, the War of Resistance against Japan won, Beijing Union Medical College decided to relocate the nursing school back to Beiping in 1946. Starting from scratch in Chengdu, the newly settled nursing school has to move back to Beiping, many things that do not need to be brought back to deal with in situ. Nie yuchan worked hard, after all arrangements, led more than 60 teachers and students to leave Chengdu on April 24, and walked for nearly two months, returned to Beiping in mid-June. In that year, the nursing school enrolled more than 10 new students. Together with the second and third graders brought back from Chengdu, the school began on October 1. At that time, the Kyowa Medical College had recovered its output from the Japanese aggressors, but most of the houses had been leased to the Executive Department of the Military Coordination Office, and neither the hospital nor the medical school had been restored, and there were problems with the teaching and clinical internships of the Nursing School. Nie yuchan went on all sides to seek assistance. He invited experts from the former Union Medical College to assist lectures. He also contacted Neutral, colleagues, mothers, infants, children and other hospitals for internship, and recruited graduates and hospital nurses to prepare for the re-opening of the hospital. On May 1, 1948, the hospital began admitting inpatient patients, and the medical school officially opened on 27 October 1948. At this point, the school care work is restored to normal order, teaching, experiments and internships are guaranteed. Hospital wards were also restored one after another, or opened all. Teaching and hospital work is on the right track again. 
Under the leadership of Nie yuchan, not only the quality of care at Concord Hospital has become a national model, but also cultivated a number of excellent nursing teachers and nursing administration personnel. Famous Public Health Care Expert in China, China's First Nightingale Medal Laureate, Honorary President of the Chinese Society of Nursing, Honorary President of the Chinese Society of Nursing, Nightingale Medal and Snow Award Winner, Honorary Dr. Lin Juying, University of Kansas City, Missouri, USA、Named by Lanzhou Military Region as Model Nursing Expert, Team Leader of Nursing Team, General Hospital of Lanzhou Military Region General Hospital Xiu Fang, the first head of nursing department after the resumption of higher nursing education, Tianjin Medical College Nursing Department Gan Lanjun, as well as many older nursing specialists in teaching and hospital leadership positions have been Nie Yuchen's students or have learned from her lessons. 
Nie yuchan saw that nursing teachers and administrative staff across the country are insufficient. Considering that undergraduate graduates alone cannot meet the needs of talented people, he has also offered various types of nursing training and study classes, and received further training students from the Ministry of Nutrition and the Ministry of Social Services. Open. This has contributed to the improvement of the professional level of active nurses throughout the country. 
In August 1950, the Ministry of Health of the People's Republic of China held the first national health conference, at which it was decided to include care in secondary education. At that time, the College of Medicine had not yet been taken over, all the work was still under the previous system, and PUCH Nursing School was still enrolled from the universities. January 20, 1951 The Central People's Government and the Ministry of Health of the General Logistics Ministry of the Chinese People's Liberation Army took over Beijing Union Medical College and Peking Union Hospital. In May, Kyowa Nursing School also enrolled a new class of students from various universities. In 1952, he was instructed to stop admissions and switch to Chinese. In 1953, the School of Nursing of the Union Medical College ended. 
Later bumpy, but unwavering
Soon after the takeover of the Union Medical College and Hospital in 1951, Nie Yuchen was sent to Sichuan to work on land reform. Her work at Xiehe Nursing School and Hospital was taken over by others. Half a year later, Nie yuchan returned to Beijing, and soon launched a three-prong, anti-five counter-and ideological reform campaign. Nie yuchan has been unfairly criticized, standing on the side at work. At that time, she couldn't make sense of cancelling the senior nursing school. It was very uncomfortable and sentimental to stop at her hands. As a result, when the Ministry of Health transferred her to the newly established General Hospital of the PLA in 1954 as vice-president. After repeated encouragement from the head of the Ministry of Health, she was hoping that she would be cheer up and play a role in the new position, her enthusiasm for her work rose again. 
After Nie yuchan reported to the PLA General Hospital, the director of the hospital did not arrange specific work for her. She had taken the initiative to gain insight into the care work in the ward and reported daily to the hospital director and made specific comments and recommendations, but the then director did not support her work. She was censorship during the 'anti-Hu' campaign that began shortly afterwards, and her job was more difficult. In order to improve his own thinking level, keep up with the situation, and be conducive to future work, Nie Yuchen submitted an application to the Institute of Socialism to study, and was approved. In the spring of 1957, Nie Yuchen studied at the Institute of Socialism. 
During the study period, 'Naruto' begins. Nie yuchan is a straight sex person. In order to develop the nursing career, she pointed out the problems in nursing work at that time and made some suggestions. Regrettably, in the immediate 'anti-right' campaign, she was classified as a right-wing element. In winter 1959, she was transferred to Anhui Provincial Hospital in Hefei, Anhui Province for rehabilitation. 
In Anhui Provincial Hospital, Nie Yuchen does not have a title, sometimes working in the ward and sometimes in rural areas. Nie yuchan never considered personal humiliation, regardless of the nature of the work, are earnestly working hard. He was sent to the pediatric ward to help the chief nurse rectify his work. She helped the nurse chief adjust the bed to the condition of the child, so that the seriously ill child could always be observed and cared for. She improved the sterile isolation system, reduced cross-infection, established a routine system with clear division of duties, and mobilized nurses to make toys for children, so that the look of the ward was quickly refreshed. Soon, her 'right' hat was removed. Nie yuchan was appointed to form the Nursing Department and serve as Nursing Director. Because of her outstanding work skills, the hospital also put the work of the Department of Nutrition into her management. With the support of the head of the hospital, Nie Yuchen was able to send nurses in the hospital. The hiring and dismissal of nurses must also be consulted by the Nursing Department. Nie yuchan set up a technical file for the nurse. The situation is gone without distinction. She also created further training opportunities for nurses, set up a system of regular meetings of nurses, unifies technical operations and restructured wards. With the collaboration of all departments of the hospital, the quality of care was rapidly improved. Soon, the hospital's nursing work became a flag in the province, and Nie yuchan was elected president of the Anhui Branch of the Chinese Nursing Society. 
In 1961 anti-' right', the president who supported Nie yuchan's work was criticized, and Nie Yuchen's work was not easy. At the beginning of 1966, Nie Yuchen submitted a retirement application to the director of the hospital due to his poor health condition and had exceeded the retirement age. The application was approved in March of that year. When the retirement procedures have not yet been completed, Nie Yuchen is resting in Beijing, the cultural revolution began. She was pulled back into Hefei and admitted to the 'cattle shed' in the hospital. It was released only in 1972 and was allowed to return to Beijing in 1973. At that time, her house had been occupied by others and could only be a

ccommodated at the family's home and was divided into a bungalow after two years. Her eyes were also due to the development of cataracts to the point of discernment across the road to ask pedestrians to pass. In 1979, her right-wing problem was completely rehabilitated, the Ministry of Health of the PLA General Logistics Department solved her housing problem, and an eye that could be operated was opened, and she gained light again. 
Nie yuchan has never been troubled for her personal gains and losses in the troubled course, but as long as she refers to the nursing career, she still thrives, she is determined to devote her life to the nursing career, but she always feels that she does too little for the people. Nie Yuchen has a high reputation in the care industry. At the age of 80, more than 100 alumni, nurses and experts from Beijing, abroad and returning from abroad gathered to wish her life. He also held a number of speeches on the stage and contributed his lifelong energy to the cause of education in the motherland.
